Name: Radio Game for Little Folks
Description:
This children's variation on Pachisi was released to take advantage of the trend in radio-based entertainment. Unlike Ludo, it uses two dice but only provides players with two pieces each. Up to four players compete to be the first to get their pieces - colored metal "Radio Horns" - all the way "Home," capturing opponents whenever they can and forcing them to start again.

The player colors correspond to real radio stations of the period: Blue is KOA Denver; Black is KHJ Los Angeles; Yellow is WEAF New York; and Red is the (still very famous) WGN Chicago.

Name: The Crimson Scales: Class Pack Add-on
Description:
Expand on your Crimson Scales experience from the online print shop with a triple class package add-on!
 Presented by outside creators GrandDuke, Yknits and Wilting Moon the Class Pack Add-On features three new classes complete with additional scenarios, monsters, items, events, tokens, custom condition, and more!

This package was designed separately from Crimson Scales, but is compatible with Crimson Scales and can be integrated into any Gloomhaven campaign. Just add the Personal Quests included to your available pool, and you're all set!

The entire Crimson Scales team is very familiar with the creators and materials included in this add-on and can testify to the quality and testing it has received. Artwork included is also from Alexandr Elichev.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Crimson Scales: Trail of Ashes
Description:
An expansion for the Crimson Scales (separate from the add-on), designed by the original Crimson Scales cast along with guest class contributors, that brings new content to integrate into your Crimson Scales campaign.

—description from the designer

Name: Heists in Hyperspace
Description:
Get the crew together - we're going on a Heist!
Heists in Hyperspace is a tabletop card game for 2-4 players. As Captain, assemble your treasure-hunting crew and make the right decisions to claim Treasures before your rival Captains do!

Each game spans three Expeditions. Each round, players take turns choosing an Encounter card to land on. You begin at the Intergalactic Bazaar, gathering and equipping your crew of Mercenaries, before setting course for the perilous corridors of the Treasure Vault.

A Vault Card is selected at the beginning of each game. Each Vault brings its own unique twist to the table, creating interesting ways for players to sabotage, deceive and outmaneuver their opponents.

After the third Expedition, the player who has gained the most Renown - through heisting Treasures, hiring notorious mercenaries and fulfilling their Ambitions - is the most accomplished Captain, and is declared the winner!

—description from the publisher

Name: Insurgent Earth: Resist or Die
Description:
Insurgent Earth is a tabletop miniatures war game set on post-alien invasion Earth where determined survivors fight to survive, thrive, and ultimately overcome the alien occupation.

Made for solo and cooperative games, Insurgent Earth is a low model count, open miniature rule set that combines quick, intuitive combat resolution with narrative elements like character customization and advancement.

Players can vary their abilities and skills, upgrade their equipment, and manage their Resistance cell's resources to run vicious, one-shot games, or fight the long war with an easy campaign system.

Another fast-play game for busy gamers, Insurgent Earth is from the author of Zona Alfa, Kontraband, Exploit Zero, and Nightwatch.

—description from the designer

Name: Baby Race
Description:
An amazing race in the park is about to start. However, it’s a dangerous racetrack: Bends, stones, potholes… Who will be the winner?

1ST Manage to roll your die inside the Speed-up area
2nd Put your hand quickly on the Position card
3rd Move through the park to the finish line

Baby Race is a family and fun boardgame where you need ability and interaction for win the game. For 2-6 players, 30 min of game and +6 years.

Easy rules and a lot components dices, cards, meeples,...

Name: The Naval SITREP: The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #3
Description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

The Naval SITREP Issue #3 was published in April 1995.

Table of contents:
Command at Sea Scenario: A raider´s battle
Kitbash Corner
Russian subs: the next generation
Command at Sea Errata II
The Convergence Zone
Convention schedule
Platform Specifications:
Russian Project 636 sub
US MV-22 Osprey
German Komoran Raider
German Ar 196
Families: Magazine: The Naval SITREP – Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming

Name: 姫と騎士 (Princess and Knight)
Description:
The stage is "Principality of Italy".

For the next big election, the aristocratic princess will perform "social", "trade" and "audience" of the political affairs to appeal her existence.
The knight who serves her princess uses her limbs to support her in the "workshop," "carriage," and "factory."
The influence of one action will increase the value of the other action.

However, the hearts of the princess and the knight are still passing each other.
When that heart passes again, the princess and the knight will be able to stand in their favor by releasing their hidden powers.
Throughout the Grand Duke, the aristocratic family recognized as the most suitable will be the next Grand Duke.

Name: Carcassonne: Promo Carcassonne Spain 2022
Description:
This set consists of 4 tiles with 3 mini expansions:


     Carcassonne Spain 22 QR-code Promo tile.
     The Bear and the Strawberry Tree.
     Alcázar of Segovia.


These tiles were given to the 2022 national Carcassonne Championship participants.


     Carcassonne Spain 22 QR-code Promo (1 tile): allows drawing a second tile to choose one, and placing a meeple on an adjacent tile. The QR-code on the tile leads to the Carcassonne Spain website where you can download the rules for these expansions.
     The Bear and the Strawberry Tree (1 tile): It comes with 7 wooden cubes to be used as inn markers that provide extra points to roads and the cities connected to them.
     Alcázar of Segovia (2 tiles): It provides points to the players with the majority in its vicinity, when fully surrounded.

Name: Way of the Mandalorian
Description:
In the board game Way of the Mandalorian you will take on the role of one of the four characters from The Mandalorian series. Rescue little Grog and make a name for yourself! Your goal will be to complete increasingly difficult missions, for which you will receive credits. The player who obtains the most credits at the end of the game will be the winner.

—description from the publisher

W grze planszowej Way of the Mandalorian wcielicie siÄ™ w jednego z czterech bohaterów z serialu The Mandalorian. Uratujcie maÅ‚ego Grogu i zyskajcie sÅ‚awÄ™! Waszym celem bÄ™dzie realizowanie coraz trudniejszych misji, za które otrzymacie kredyty. Gracz, który pod koniec gry uzyska ich najwiÄ™cej, zostanie zwyciÄ™zcÄ….

—description from the publisher (Polish)

In dem Brettspiel Way of the Mandalorian schlüpfen Sie in die Rolle eines der vier Charaktere aus der Serie The Mandalorian. Rette den kleinen Grog und mach dir einen Namen! Ihr Ziel ist es, immer schwierigere Missionen zu erfüllen, für die Sie Punkte erhalten. Der Spieler, der am Ende des Spiels die meisten Credits hat, ist der Gewinner.

—description from the publisher (German)

Name: Wild West Rush
Description:
Wild West Rush is a racing game where the players are characters from the Old West. Each character has a special ability that gives him/her an advantage during the game and the objective of the game is to be the first player to complete two laps around the board. 
The players roll the dice and move forward the number of squares indicated by the value of the dice. When they land on a trapped square, the players must fulfil the consequence of the square. The players decide when they want to use their special ability, as long as they do so on their turn and before they roll the dice, and furthermore, the players can only use their special ability once during the entire game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Vabang!
Description:
Whoever of you is the first to come up with a question that links the words on the card presses the button! He will then start to light up and play a tune. At this time, each of you can give your answer to the question and press the button to take your opponent's point. Each of you only has a few seconds to give 2 quick answers! Think outside the box and surprise your opponents. Bet everything on Vabang! The player who gets 10 cards first is the winner.

—description from the publisher (English)

Kto z Was jako pierwszy wymyÅ›li pytanie, które Å‚Ä…czy wyrazy z karty, naciska przycisk! Wtedy on zacznie Å›wieciÄ‡ i odtwarzaÄ‡ melodiÄ™. W tym czasie kaÅ¼dy z Was moÅ¼e udzieliÄ‡ swojej odpowiedzi na zadane pytanie i nacisnÄ…Ä‡ przycisk, aby przejÄ…Ä‡ punkt przeciwnika. KaÅ¼dy z Was ma tylko kilka sekund na udzielenie 2 szybkich odpowiedzi! MyÅ›l nieszablonowo i zaskocz swoich przeciwników. Postaw wszystko na Vabang! Gracz, który jako pierwszy zdobÄ™dzie 10 kart, zostaje zwyciÄ™zcÄ….

—description from the publisher (Polish)

Wer von euch als Erster eine Frage findet, die die Wörter auf der Karte verbindet, drückt den Knopf! Dann beginnt er zu leuchten und eine Melodie zu spielen. Zu diesem Zeitpunkt kann jeder von euch seine Antwort auf die Frage geben und den Knopf drücken, um den Punkt des Gegners zu übernehmen. Jeder von Ihnen hat nur ein paar Sekunden Zeit, um 2 kurze Antworten zu geben! Denken Sie über den Tellerrand hinaus und überraschen Sie Ihre Gegner. Setzen Sie alles auf Vabang! Der Spieler, der zuerst 10 Karten erhält, ist der Gewinner.

—description from the publisher (German)

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Nick Fury & S.H.I.E.L.D. Agents
Description:
Nicholas Fury, Junior is the son of famed S.H.I.E.L.D. Director Nick Fury. 
A veteran Army Ranger who served overseas, Nick Fury returned to the United States following the murder of his mother. He tracked down and neutralized the killer with the help of the Avengers and S.H.I.E.L.D., after which he became one of the top operatives of the Strategic Homeland Intervention, Enforcement, and Logistics Division. 
In addition to his high level strategic and tactical skills, Nick Fury has inherited the Infinity Formula in his blood, giving him faster healing and peak physical capabilities.

Accompanying Fury on operations is an elite fireteam of S.H.I.E.L.D. operatives. 
Outfitted with the latest in advanced weaponry and equipment, these agents support Fury in the field and secure vital assets in a crisis. Each is a highly-skilled, dedicated agent trained in both covert operations and full-scale crisis containment.

Name: Solar Century
Description:
Solar Century is a heavy strategy game with combinative card play that aims to capture the political theatre of interplanetary colonization on a grand scale.

Players act as the Council of the Imperator who rules the solar system. Each turn marks the passing of ten unified solar years.

Starting the game, the Council drafts four colonies who send their leaders to explore and conquer planets. Players wield influence over these colony leaders to initiate actions and they have a century to prove themself to the Imperator or take over its Seat.

Each round has three phases:
- AUDIENCE: ask the Imperator to send agents to a region of the solar system,
- COLONIZATION: either make alliances or wield influence on an ally to initiate and action up to two times,
- SOLSTICE: develop a colony and prepare for the next turn.

A player within the Council wins with
- the most influence over the colony, which controls at least six planets at the end of a round (absolute win) or
- the most victory points at the end of the century (capital win).

—description from the designer

Name: Redraw
Description:
Redraw is a unique social game in which you will be able to express your artistic IAM. Your task will be to paint, redraw and embellish the drawings that other players have previously created. Earn cards by guessing slogans drawn by others.

The winner will be the person who first
5 password cards.

—description from the publisher (English)

Redraw to wyjÄ…tkowa gra towarzyska, w której bÄ™dziecie mogli wyraziÄ‡ swoje artystyczne JA. Waszym zadaniem bÄ™dzie malowanie, przerysowywanie oraz upiÄ™kszanie rysunków które stworzyli wczeÅ›niej inni gracze. Zdobywajcie karty, odgadujÄ…c hasÅ‚a narysowane przez innych.

ZwyciÄ™zcÄ… zostanie osoba, która jako pierwsza
uzyska 5 kart z hasÅ‚ami.

—description from the publisher (Polish)

Redraw ist ein einzigartiges soziales Spiel, in dem du deinen künstlerischen IAM zum Ausdruck bringen kannst. Ihre Aufgabe ist es, die Zeichnungen, die andere Spieler zuvor erstellt haben, zu malen, neu zu zeichnen und zu verschönern. Verdiene Karten, indem du die von anderen gezeichneten Sprüche errätst.

Der Gewinner ist die Person, die zuerst
5 Passwort-Karten.

—description from the publisher (German)
Families: Components: Dry Erase Markers / Dry Erase Surfaces

Name: Someecards The Game
Description:
Introducing the adult party game from somewhat internationally acclaimed humor brand Someecards.
     Compete with your friends and frenemies to create the funniest Someecards.
     Each box contains 75 Someecards, 360 Caption cards, and 1 Instruction card. With 27,000 possible combinations you'll have years of fun.
     It's the game where everyone's a winner, except for the people who lose.

Name: ÍNTIMOOS Parejas: Conversaciones para [re]conocerse
Description:
The game that will cheer up your relationship as a couple. Cards with questions divided into 3 levels (flirting, intimate and love) depending on where you are in your relationship.

Contains a total of 180 cards with 5 different categories:


     Intimate revelations 
     Complicity 
     Future & Plans
     Challenge 
     Hot


First person to get 5 questions right wins

Name: Midnight Sun: Borealis – Part 1 (fan expansion for Android: Netrunner)
Description: The first half of the Borealis Cycle for Netrunner. This includes 65 new cards with new mechanics. Set in the arctic, runners explore the northern branches of Weyland and NBN to discover what they are up to in the arctic circle
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Sagrada: Promo 13 – Galápagos Jogos
Description:
Sagrada promo card with the Galápagos Jogos logo.

Originally available through localization partner Galápagos Jogos.

This is a 3 and 5 difficulty card.

Name: Sagrada: Promo 15 – Geekach Games Window Pattern Card
Description:
A new double sided player card to build the stained glass window.  Shuffle into your deck and procede as normal.

A 3 & 6 level difficulty card showcasing localization parter Geekach Games.

Name: CATAN: The Helpers
Description:
Meet your new best friends on the island of Catan!
These 12 helpful characters generously share their skills and expertise to help you develop your fledgling communities into thriving cities.
Whether it's protection from rolling a 7, moving a road, or chasing away the robber, The Helpers are always ready to lend a hand.
With two new helper abilities, and all-new characters, this updated scenario for CATAN adds more flavor and variety to your games.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sagrada: 2022 Promo Pack
Description:
Continue building your collection with all the Sagrada promos released from 2020 through 2021! This direct-exclusive pack contains two years of promos we've given at conventions, through reviewers, localization partners, and a promo exclusive to this pack! Limited quantity printed!

Promo pack Includes these Window Pattern Cards:
2022 Promo Pack Exclusive SA01.18.2022
Man vs. Meeple Season 3
Dice Tower 2020
Game Store 2020
Tantrum House 2020
Galapagos Jogos
Game Boy Geek
Geekach Games
CuseCon
Gathering of Friends

—description from the publisher

This pack is also the only way to get the "Promo Pack Exclusive" SA01-18 which is a window tile on the back of the information card.

Name: Journal 29 Oblivion: Interactive Book Game
Description:
Journal 29 Oblivion is a unique book game where you can solve puzzles and submit your answers online to get the keys to move forward in the story. To solve the puzzles, you need to think out of the box. You can write, draw, search, fold pages, combine different methods and try to get those puzzles right. Journal 29 Oblivion is a 110 pages physical book with over 40 puzzles to solve.


    It is not necessary to have solved Journal 29 & Journal 29 Revelation  to enjoy Journal 29  Oblivion.

Name: Codenames: Bonus Pack – Webhallen
Description: 10 bonuscards for Codenames with a tech theme.

Name: The Maze Explorers: Arctic World
Description:
Find your way out of an arctic maze using your wits, fishing pole and a limited supply of fish.

You and your fellow intrepid explorers are off to explore an arctic maze. Using only your wits, a fishing pole and a limited supply of fish you must create and navigate a maze path to find the way out. You will encounter twists and turns, polar bears and ice. You may even find yourself stranded on an ice floe, but you can be the hero of the group by being the first one to expose the maze path and find the exit!

Your Goal: Create a complete, unbroken maze path between the Maze Entrance and the Maze Exit and be the first Explorer to exit the maze. However, be careful not to get stranded in the maze without fish to eat and to keep the polar bears away!

Exploring the Maze:
Your maze exploration starts by shuffling all the maze tiles facedown and placing them on the table in front of you, being sure to connect at least one edge of each tile to another. You will then roll one or two dice to move over the tiles, turn them faceup, rotate them, and uncover the maze before you run out of your limited supply of fish.

Along the way you will search for the hidden exit while also encountering various artifacts. Some artifacts, like the fishing holes, will help you to continue your explorations, others, like the polar bear, are not so helpful!

This is a fun, easy-to-learn game that's different each time you play. Winning this game will require you to adapt your strategy at various stages in the game.

The Maze Explorers Trilogy!

The Maze Explorers is a series of worlds each with its own set of unique artifacts and challenges. Each world can be played on its own or combined into a larger world (see the "Related Games" at the top of this page). Stay tuned to the keithkunstgames.com web site and watch for the "Multi-World Explorer" update that will allow you to play the combined version of all three worlds.

—description from the designer

Name: RWBY: Combat Ready – Team JNPR Expansion
Description:
Team JNPR has entered the fray! Introducing four unique Huntsmen to battle alongside team RWBY against the forces of Grimm. Play as honorable Lie Ren, dependable Jaune, feisty Nora, and the legendary Pyrrha – or mix-and-match Huntsmen from the base game to craft your perfect team.

Earn experience to customize your Huntsmen’s abilities between scenarios and prepare for the formidable challenges ahead!

—description from the publisher

Name: The Naval SITREP: The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #4
Description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system (Fear God and Dread Naught, Command at Sea and Harpoon) with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

The Naval SITREP Issue #4 was published in July 1995.

Table of contents:
Harpoon Scenario: Split Personality
Command at Sea: 2nd Edition Gun Rules
KItbash corner: The Canadian Rivers
Platforms Specifications:
German type 212
Indian Mig 21-93 Fishbed
US Elco PT boat
US MArtin M139HW
Families: Magazine: The Naval SITREP – Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming

Name: Shugo
Description:
Shugo is a lite strategy game set in a fantasy landscape where players can choose among mythical warrior factions in order to control the battlefield.

For a player to win, they must set a straight line (horizontal, vertical or diagonal) with the cards of their deck in a 5x5 square.

In each turn, the player can play a warrior or action card. Warriors will be put on the battlefield, trying to complete the straigth line. Action cards will improve conditions to reach the winning goal or will make obstacles for the oponent.

Depending on which faction you play as, your attack strategy will greatly differ:

Amazons: A tactical and aggressive faction, whose main focus is to destroy enemy warriors, removing those cards from the battlefield.

Knights: A protective faction that relies in resistance and pushing over other cards from desired positions in the battlefield.

Wizards: A strategic faction that alters the battlefield to win their objectives, locking desired positions or displacing warriors across the battlefield.

Undead: A dreadful faction that bases its power in Turning enemies into skeletons at its service.

—description from the publisher

Name: Coloring Battle Cards
Description:
Coloring Battle Cards is a Trading Card Game that uses very simple rules and cards you can color and battle with your friends.

Each player requires their own deck to play.

(Description from the starter deck packaging)

Each player's deck consists of attack cards and defense cards, ranging in value from 1 to 5, and a single Character card representing the player's persona during the game.

On each player's turn, they draw up to 3 cards in hand, then they may choose to play an attack card and select an opponent to attack.  The defender may then choose a defense card to play.  If the defense card equals or exceeds the attack card, the defender takes no damage.  If the attack card is greater, the difference between the attack and defense card is discarded from the top of the defender's draw pile as damage.  A player may make up to three such attacks on their turn, then discard any cards they do not want to keep.

Play proceeds left around the table. Each player whose draw deck is emptied is eliminated, and the last player with cards in their draw pile wins.

Name: Western Legends: Prospecting Deck Variant
Description:
The Western Legends: Prospecting Deck adds more variety to your wild west adventures! Determining when and where gold nuggets become available to be mined. It also introduces brand new mining events! Making each game feel fresh and unique.


     Nuggets spawn as players become legendary.
     Randomizes amount available at each mine.
     16 card deck fits in the Western Legends: Mountain Range.

Name: Escape from Arrow Caverns
Description:
Turn the cave to your advantage in Escape from Arrow Caverns, a single-player strategy game which challenges the player to search for buried treasures while planning their escape route out of a collapsing cave network. You'll need to plan carefully as you help a team of spelunkers through an increasingly-perilous maze of unstable caverns.

During the player's turns, there are several phases. They first direct their team of spelunkers to explores the cave's caverns using limited movement cards. They must follow the arrows on each cavern's floor. Second, each spelunker surveys their occupied caverns by rotating the arrow. But be careful--once each cavern can only be moved once! Third, each spelunker excavates their caverns to search for buried treasure. However, each time a cavern is excavated, it becomes unstable! If they linger on that cavern in the future, the entire cave will collapse, and the player will lose!

Finally, after revealing all four of the buried treasures, each spelunker must return to starting Daylight cavern and escape before the end of the seventh turn. If they can do this, then the player wins!

Can you explore the cave, excavate all four treasures, and lead your team to safety before Arrow Caverns collapses?

—description from the designer

Name: Midway: Deluxe Edition
Description:
In the summer of 1942, the Japanese Combined Fleet sought a decisive battle with the U.S. Pacific Fleet to put the Americans out of action. Admiral Yamamoto chose Midway Island, at the far eastern end of the Hawaiian chain, as a target for which the Americans would fight. The Americans indeed came to fight, sinking all four of Yamamoto’s fleet carriers for the loss of one of their own.

Midway Deluxe Edition features not only the climactic Battle of Midway but also the attempted relief of Wake Island, the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor, and battles that might have followed the clash of carriers.

Midway Deluxe Edition includes 560 playing pieces: 280 “long” ship pieces and 280 square ones representing aircraft, smaller ships and markers needed for play. There are two operational maps forming a 42x28-inch playing area covering the Hawai’ian islands, Midway and surrounding waters.

Like its sister game South Pacific, Midway Deluxe Edition includes not only the standard, generic Tactical Map but also a special Tactical Map, this time showing Pearl Harbor with all of the locations of American warships on the fateful morning of December 7th, 1941.

There are 36 scenarios, organized in our popular “story arc” format that weaves the narrative of the campaign into the scenarios, allowing them to tell the story of these pivotal battles.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Second World War at Sea (Avalanche Press)

Name: 1マス先は闇 (The future is a closed tiles)
Description:
Backgammon-based board game
The first player to complete a circle of 28 squares from the beginning to the end wins!

To move forward, use the tiles from 1 to 4 and the dice.
When a tile is used, the square advances by the number of the tile.
Then, the used number tiles are temporarily disabled.
(The number of ways to move forward narrows as the game progresses).

The effect is activated by flipping over the square you have advanced.
There are 14 types of effects, including ”the effect to advance oneself by one square” and ”the effect to change the opponent's position” and so on.
Aim for the top while activating the various effects!

There is one important thing to remember!
What happens if you pass the goal?
Let's go around again to get to the end.

—description from the publisher

Name: ゴモクタイル (Gomoku tile)
Description:
This is a game of Five-in-a-Row in which five or more stones of the player's own color.
There are squares with an "X" on them, which are obstacles for both players.

The background of the tiles can be white or gray.
When placing a tile, the color of that square has to be checkered.
It is possible to be on the verge of a fifth square, but not be able to place it because of the tiles.

—description from the publisher

Name: Wok and Roll: The Korean Wave
Description:
The Korean Wave continues the combo-building, dice-rolling cooking fun of Wok and Roll by introducing two different trifold menus with all-new mechanics.

These two deliciously illustrated Korean food inspired menus have unique features to spice up your games such as the Kimchi mechanic, First Flowers that players can race for, and a skill tree with new skills to try out.

-description from publisher

Name: Leylines
Description:
Your ancestors have lived in the forest for generations, surviving by following the Leylines - tangled wisps of magic that weave between the pines and lead to the forest’s most coveted bounties. But you can’t sustain yourself on only moss and berries for long. Every solstice, the fae-markets roll into the forest with their caravans bursting with food and supplies.  Gather what you can from the woodland floor and seek out the markets before they move on.

Leylines is a re-imagining/update of the classic game Auf Achse by Wolfgang Kramer set in a brand new world with new rules by Daryl Andrews, featuring beautiful acrylic standees and a circular board filled magical leylines and mystical markets!

To win, players must collect resources in the forest and bring them back along the leylines to the markets to sell them. Be aware though the magical merchants pay different amounts depending on what they are interested in!

Each round players will take turns waking up and preparing for the day by placing their dice to program their actions and then adventuring through the forest using their placed dice. They will pick up resources along the way and deliver them to the markets for either Gold or Magical items to help them in their journey.

-description from publisher

Name: SKETCH
Description:
Test your ingenuity with party game Sketch!

In this dice game from the makers of Party and Co, you must use your ingenuity and imagination to create the smartest and most original drawing.

The challenge? The drawing board already contains a number of scribbles that you should use!
 You don't have to be a Picasso to win this game, by drawing the most original objects or concepts you score the most points!

The rules of this game are simple, making it easy to learn and quick to get started. The small size of this board game makes it easy to take with you to any occasion with family or friends!

Sketch and win!
The goal of Sketch is to make the most original drawings, so that you score the most points after 6 rounds! How to play Sketch:
1. All players take the same board with basic scribbles
2. The first player rolls the die with letters. The letter placed on top determines what will be drawn.
3. Fast! Everyone has to make 4 drawings that start with this letter. The drawing board contains basic scribbles that you should use to create your drawing!
4. The first player to complete their four drawings yells STOP! All players must then stop drawing and show the drawings made, after which a number of points are awarded.
5. Repeat this with the different boards until there have been 6 rounds of play. The player with the most points at the end of 6 rounds wins the game!

--

Test je vindingrijkheid met het partyspel Sketch!
Bij dit dobbelspel van de makers van Party en Co moet je je vindingrijkheid en fantasie gebruiken om de slimste en origineelste tekening te maken. 
De uitdaging? Het tekenbord bevat al een aantal krabbels waar je gebruik van moet maken! 
Voor dit spel hoef je geen Picasso te zijn om te kunnen winnen, door het tekenen van de meest originele voorwerpen of begrippen scoor je de meeste punten!

De spelregels van dit spel zijn simpel, waardoor het makkelijk aan te leren is en snel opgestart kan worden. Het kleine formaat van dit gezelschapsspel maakt dat het dat makkelijk mee te nemen is naar elke gelegenheid met familie of vrienden!

Sketch en win!
Het doel van Sketch is om de meest originele tekeningen te maken, zodat je na 6 rondes de meeste punten scoort! Zo speel je Sketch:
1. Alle spelers pakken hetzelfde bord met basiskrabbels
2. De eerste speler gooit de dobbelsteen met letters. De letter die bovenop komt te liggen, bepaalt wat er getekend gaat worden.
3. Snel! Iedereen moet 4 tekeningen maken die met deze letter beginnen. Het tekenbord bevat basiskrabbels die je moet gebruiken om jouw tekening te maken!
4. De eerste speler die zijn vier tekeningen af heeft, roept STOP! Alle spelers moeten dan stoppen met tekenen en de gemaakte tekeningen laten zien, waarna er een aantal punten wordt toegekend.
5. Herhaal dit met de verschillende borden tot er 6 speelrondes zijn geweest. De speler die aan het einde van 6 rondes de meeste punten heeft, wint het spel!

Name: Warmachine: MKIV
Description:
The newest version of the full-metal fantasy miniatures game, with new armies, new rules, and new heroes.  New rules include Command Cards, warjack customization, spell list customization, and new army construction rules!

Warmachine is a fast-paced 32mm skirmish game for two or more players in the Iron Kingdoms setting.  After collecting, assembling, and painting your miniatures, you'll compete against your opponent to accomplish scenario objective and to destroy their forces in a quick-moving game.

WARMACHINE MKIV simplifies and streamlines the rules from the previous edition of the game, breaking factions into finite, closed armies, while changing several rules people have learned to use over previous editions.  Facing and free strikes are gone.  Templates are gone.  Movement is simpler and faster.  Hills are back.  And new factions enter the fray, as the battles for the Iron Kingdoms begin anew.

Name: CobbleCritters
Description:
In CobbleCritters, you’ll duel another Tamer for control of the Cavern, a mystical space filled with powerful Crystals.

In the game, you build two decks — a Critter deck and a Special deck — and you can always choose which to draw from. Critters are your monsters while Specials are a grab-bag of tricky hijinks, trinkets, and rule-warping events. You refill your entire 6-card hand every turn, giving the game's cardplay a fast pace.
A player's board is a grid split into two areas, the Hideout and the Cavern. Players prepare their Critters in the Hideout and then send them to the Cavern to battle for Crystals, a precious resource that functions as score.

Critters have stats used for battle and a “Star Rank." Critters can be upgraded from 1 to 2 and then 3 Stars to power them up. They also have card text that grants them a wide variety of combo-able powers.

Strategic positioning, clever deckbuilding, and a pinch of luck are key to victory in the Caverns!

Name: Tujuh Rupa
Description:
Tujuh Rupa is a game for 3-5 players where you play as one of Night Buddies, inspired by Indonesian ghosts and mystical beings, collecting the most powerful Relics to become the winner.

In each of your turns, you have to play a Relic card from your hand to your Active Field in order to gain its point at the end of the game. These Relics also have different effects that can be activated to create disruptions for your opponent.

Can you collect the most powerful Relics in order to win this Relic quest?

-description from designer

Name: Quabble
Description:
Quabble is a drawless connection game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces (squares) of an initially empty square board. The top and bottom edges of the board are colored black; the left and right edges are colored white. The board squares alternate between a light and a dark color in a checkered fashion. On odd-sized boards, the center square must be light-colored.

				
				
					PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, perform exactly one of the following actions:


     Place a stone of your color on an empty light square and on each adjoining dark square that you now control. You control a dark square if your stones occupy more than half of its adjacent light squares.



     Place a stone of your color on an empty dark square that you contest. You contest a dark square if your stones occupy exactly half of its adjacent light squares.


You win by completing a chain of interconnected stones of your color touching the two opposite board edges of your color. Two stones are connected if they occupy orthogonally adjacent squares or diagonally adjacent dark squares.

The pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means White will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with Black instead of making a regular move.

				
				
					VariantsQualos: On your turn, place a stone of your color on an empty light square, or place a stone of your color on an empty dark square that you contest or control, or flip an enemy stone on a dark square that you control. To flip a stone is to replace it with a stone of the opposite color. Controlling and contesting are based on orthogonal lines of sight rather than on mere adjacencies, and stones on dark squares also count towards them.

Fast Quabble: On your turn, place a stone of your color on an empty light square and on each adjoining dark square that you now control. You control a dark square if your stones occupy at least half of its adjacent light squares.

Conquare: Play on an uncheckered square board. Vertices take the place of light squares, and spaces take the place of dark squares. Two stones are connected if they occupy orthogonally adjacent spaces or a space and an adjacent vertex.

Fast Conquare: Conquare with the control rule from Fast Quabble.

-description from designer

Name: Cellulose: A Plant Cell Biology Game – Scenario Pack I
Description:
Pack of 3 new Scenarios for Cellulose: A Plant Cell Biology Game.

The Community Garden Scenario adds private objective cards. Players begin with an easy "A" objective that earn a small reward and a choice of more difficult "B" objective cards that provide large benefits or additional asymmetric abilities.

The Venus Flytrap Scenario makes it harder but more rewarding to to gain protein.

The Coffee Plant Scenario jump starts the game with starting cards and resources that give more early strategic direction to experienced players.

Name: Super Dark
Description:
Everyone knows money can buy political influence, but did you know that some groups can spend millions to shape our elections without revealing where their funds came from?  This is a game about how elections can be shaped by money.

Players are secretly assigned to one of two teams — Citizen or Super PAC — and compete to elect candidates through strategic donations. Super PAC players know each other and can corrupt politicians with their donations, so it’s up to Citizens to figure out who the Super PAC players are and work around them to elect honest politicians and keep democracy healthy.

Every round, all players draw 2 money cards from the bank and publicly donate a money card to one of the candidates. All money donated by Super PAC players secretly counts as dark money. When a candidate receives enough money to be funded, players learn whether the candidate was "resisted" (a point for the Citizens) or "corrupted" (i.e. enough dark money was donated to corrupt the candidate - a point for the Super PACs).

Super PACs win if they corrupt half the candidates. Citizens win if they can stop the Super PACs!

Name: BelloLudi: Pikes – Wargame 1530-1660
Description:
This ruleset simulates battles in the period of 1530 to roughly 1660 AD. A time when tremendous changes took place in the field of warfare. The advent of gunpowder transformed the way in which armies fought on the battlefield, bringing more and more gunpowder weapons to bare. Slowly changing from massed troop formations to more linear tactics. Empires were forged, colonies were taken and feudal warfare slowly gave way to more national conflicts. These rules can be used for the English Civil War, the various Wars of Religion, the 80 and 30 Years’ Wars and many others.

-description from publisher's website

Name: The Gallery
Description:
The Gallery is an 18-card game where players are curators trying to secure the best and most expensive paintings for their Galleries. With a limited hand, players can draw cards, trade from the market, or place your paintings in their gallery for end-game points and powerful abilities. But Curator beware, your Gallery has limited space, and you can only place 4 paintings at a time! The game ends when the limited deck is depleted and the player whose Gallery is worth the most, wins the game!

The Gallery is a free Print and Play game designed for 2-3 players.

–description from designer
Families: Theme: Fine Art and Art Museums

Name: Radio Game
Description:
This card game, not dissimilar from gin rummy, includes 56 cards: 48 cards bear the call signs of real radio stations throughout the USA, as well as some international stations; there are also four S.O.S. cards and four "Listening In" cards, which have special rules. The winner is the first to score 500 points.

The game was copyrighted 1923, but had already been relegated to a list of budget (30 cent) party or family games in the 1925, 1927, and 1928 Parker Brothers catalogs. It does not appear again following the 1928 catalog.

Note: national radio broadcasts were new and trendy in the early 1920s, inspiring many games with similar titles. This is NOT the same game as Game of Radio (1924), Milton Bradley's Radio Game (1925), or All-Fair's Toon-in Radio Game (1925) or Radio Game for Little Folks (1926), all of which are separate and distinct products.

Name: Gyre
Description:
Gyre is a drawless connection game for two, played on an initially empty hexhex board. The players take turns placing a stone of their own color until a winner is determined.

You win by making a group with the following property: Even if you only had that group, and the rest of the board were filled with enemy stones, no enemy group would cover the majority of the cells comprising the perimeter cells and the center cell.

Gyre was invented by Mark Steere in 2015. The above is not Mark's original description, but it is equivalent. Read the original description on the publisher's web site: marksteeregames.com.

Name: Manic Mages
Description:
In Manic Mages, 2-6 players each take command of 1 of 7 magic-wielding characters and, on their turn, moves them out from a group of 4 starting hexagonal tiles to reveal new tiles and quickly build a fantasy dungeon to explore and conquer.

Players also draw Spell Cards on their turn, using the damage and utility effects of these single-use cards to slay groups of various fantasy monsters on the revealed tiles. In doing so, they collect the monster tokens for victory points and claim new Loot Cards with weapons or relics that can empower their character with persistent effects.

As the game progresses, characters become increasingly potent until they are able to discover and slay the 4 Objective tiles shuffled into the bottom of the tile stack, each of which contains the most points and strongest group of monsters in the game. Slaying any objective immediately ends the game, and the player with the largest number of Victory Points wins.

-description from designer

Name: Battle for the Empire
Description:
'Battle for the Empire' is a competitive strategy game, set in the Roman Empire. A game for 3-5 players, players must amass legions, horde gold, and gain senate support to control the board.

With 15 different Emperors to choose from, each player has unique abilities and traits to take advantage of during the game.
Every player resolves a number of phases per turn:
They will first collect tax from the Provinces they own and also gather Senate Support points according to the number of their Provinces. They then decide how many Legions to pay for and recruit, and place them anywhere they have a Garrison stationed.

From there, the player moves any number of Legions they wish, into whatever provinces they share borders with; this could mean conquering a new location, regrouping with their Garrisons or Invading another player!

If an Invasion occurs, the players concerned must resolve the conflict - first based on numbers, then Emperor's traits, and then the use of ability cards!

Once a conflict is resolved, the player will draw a Catastrophe card!
Catastrophes will threaten to destroy you throughout the game by costing you Gold, Legions or Senate Support. Many Emperors will have traits that can help them against certain Catastrophes. Otherwise, the player must rely on sound strategy and luck to survive and conquer! Each Catastrophe can effect either the current player, or other players depending on circumstance!

The game is an elimination process; if an Emperor loses any one of the main three currencies (Gold, Senate Support & Legions), then they die and are eliminated.

Once there are only two remaining players, the rush begins - the first Emperor to 20 Provinces wins the game!

Name: Panzer Grenadier: River Battleships
Description:
During the Second World War, several Eastern European nations fielded flotillas of river monitors - armored, shallow-draft warships that operated on the great rivers. These gunboats (anything on a river is a “boat” no matter its size) were designed to provide artillery support, engage enemy troops and if necessary, to fight other river monitors.

River Battleships introduces these armored warships to Panzer Grenadier. These are the actual river warships that served Poland, Czechoslovakia, Romania, Germany, Yugoslavia, Croatia, Austria and the Soviet Union. There are 45 river monitor pieces (the same size as the ship pieces in our naval games), 32 slightly smaller river gunboat pieces, 50 special markers for the river craft and 64 standard Panzer Grenadier sized pieces with troops, weapons and leaders.

River Battleships is a complete game, with two 11x17-inch maps showing the beautiful blue Danube (or Dnepr, or Pripyet) in its full watery glory, a full set of Panzer Grenadier series game rules and charts, special rules for riverine combat, and sixteen new scenarios featuring river monitor action (plus one introductory scenario with just ground units).

-description from publisher's website

Name: Midway: Rising Sun 1940
Description:
In May 1940, U.S. President Franklin D. Roosevelt ordered the U.S. Pacific Fleet to move its major base from San Diego, California to Pearl Harbor, Hawaii. The Japanese government rightly interpreted this as a threat, as Roosevelt intended. The Japanese would not strike for another 18 months, but had they done so the fleets involved would have been very different. The U.S. Navy still operated biplanes from its carriers, while ships like Hornet and Shokaku had not been commissioned while Oahu is not yet the impregnable fortress it would soon become.

Midway: Rising Sun 1940 is a Campaign Study with 10 scenarios depicting a Japanese campaign in Hawaiian waters opposed by the American Pacific Fleet of 1940 – one with far less capable aircraft (biplanes!) and fewer of them. To play these scenarios, you’ll need Midway Deluxe Edition and Bismarck Second Edition.

-description from publisher's website
Families: Series: Second World War at Sea (Avalanche Press)

Name: Panzer Grenadier: Lithuania's Iron Wolves – Legend of the Iron Wolf
Description:
In Panzer Grenadier: Lithuania’s Iron Wolves we told the stories of four campaigns that never happened, stories of Lithuanian resistance to Polish, German and Soviet aggression. In the actual events, the out-numbered and out-gunned Lithuanians did not offer armed resistance. Lithuania suffered brutal German and Soviet occupation anyway.

Legend of the Iron Wolf is a Campaign Study that continues the story with two more campaigns that never actually happened, both involving the Lithuanian Army. Campaign Five sends Lithuanian troops into battle against the Soviets in Operation Barbarossa. Campaign Six has them fighting the Germans in June 1941. In both cases, you get to use all of those tank pieces on the Lithuania’s Iron Wolves sheet. Each campaign of course wraps up with a battle game.

Two play all ten scenarios, you’ll need Lithuania’s Iron Wolves as well as maps from Fire in the Steppe, and pieces from Fire in the Steppe, 1940: The Fall of France and Slovakia’s War.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Panzer Grenadier: Changsha Operation
Description:
At dusk on Christmas Eve 1941, the Imperial Japanese Army’s 11th Army began a renewed offensive against Changsha, the capital of Hunan Province. What was intended as a diversion to keep the Chinese from interfering with the Japanese attack on Hong Kong became a major operation of its own. The six Chinese armies (each the size of a small Western corps, with very little artillery and no armor) of the IX War Zone met the Eastern Sea Demons and drove them back, nearly encircling 11th Army and causing a general retreat.

Changsha Operation comes with 88 new pieces and eight new scenarios, all based on this crucial World War Two battle. It introduces the Chinese National Revolutionary Army (the central government’s army) to the Panzer Grenadier series; they have lots of infantry, some mortar and machine-gun platoons, and not much else. Artillery was held at army level; the Chinese divisions at Changsha had none of their own.

Panzer Grenadier: Changsha Operation is a download; you’ll have to assemble the pieces yourself. The Japanese come from The Kokoda Campaign (we also included them as a download), and the maps from Korean War: Pusan Perimeter and Korean War: Counter Attack.

-description from publisher's website

Name: River Battleships: Blue Danube
Description:
The First Great War ended in December 1916 with Wilson’s Peace, a negotiated settlement that left all parties vaguely dissatisfied (except those no longer called on to die by the millions). The Second Great War erupted in August 1940, with Serbian, Russian, French and Italian armies attacking the Central Powers in a naked grab for territory and power.

Armies and fleets were not the only forces the aggressors deployed. Along the broad Danube River, the Austrian flotilla fought to keep their Serbian enemies from pushing upstream into the heart of the Monarchy. The armored riverine warships, known as monitors, featured heavy guns and thick armor, in effect small battleships maximized for the river environment. But Serbia had built its own fleet of river vessels, as had their ally, Romania.

River Battleships: Blue Danube is an expansion set for Panzer Grenadier: River Battleships. It comes with are 84 new playing pieces: 20 “long” river monitors, 16 “short” river gunboats and minelayers, and 48 standard-sized ones for troops and leaders. Plus, you get a set of 10 scenarios so you can play with them.

River Battleships: Blue Danube is a free expansion set download; you’ll have to assemble the pieces yourself. The rules and maps and markers come from River Battleships.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Panzer Grenadier: Peace in Our Time
Description:
World War II was scheduled to begin on 28 September 1938, when German armies would cross into neighboring Czechoslovakia. Unexpectedly, Britain and France agreed to almost all German demands, and the Munich Agreement caused the Germans to cancel their plans.

The Czech Army numbered 1.5 million men, with 17 regular and 17 more reserve infantry divisions and four “rapid” divisions. Their tanks and artillery greatly out-classed those of the Germans. Germany had a paper strength of 3.3 million men, though thanks to the rapid expansion of the German Army not all of these were as yet fully trained. The Czechs would be fighting for their homeland, behind a thick line of modern fortifications sited in harsh terrain, and many of the Army’s leaders as well as rank-and-file were not only willing but eager to fight the Germans. The Benes government, almost completely surrounded by German-controlled territory, instead yielded.

That doesn’t happen in Panzer Grenadier: Peace in Our Time. The Czechs fight, and they fight very hard. The Czech Army is well-equipped with tanks, soft vehicles, artillery, anti-tank guns and super-heavy machine guns. You get 176 new pieces and ten new scenarios, all based on battles that could have happened, according to the detailed war plans of both sides.

Panzer Grenadier: Peace in Our Time is a free download; you’ll have to assemble the pieces yourself. The Germans come from 1940: The Fall of France, and the maps from Fire in the Steppe, Elsenborn Ridge and Broken Axis.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Reversal
Description:
Reversal is a Reversi game.

This is mixed elements of shogi pieces. Some tiles can be flipped over by pinching both ends of the tiles, while others have a unique way of flipping over. It is hard to decide which tile to use and when. It is a game where reversals occur with every move.

There are two main types of tiles:
Normal tiles: Tiles are turned over if the end of the row or column is a tile of your color, just like in reversi.
Ability tiles: Tiles are turned over in the direction of the "â–²" or "line" on the tile.
The color of the tile to be flipped over is not distinguished.
If your ability tile is flipped over, you lose points and it becomes a tile of your opponent's color, but you can find the difference.
Also, each ability tile has its own points.

There are two rules you can play by

(1) Point rule
At the end of the game, the player with the higher point total of the ability tiles of his/her color that are turned over wins!

(2) Majority Rule
The player with the highest number of tiles of his/her color on the table at the end of the game wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Dice-ki
Description:
"The die is not cast."
Dice are used as pieces, but no dice are rolled. 
It is a Shogi-like board game focusing on the position of the "â—" on the die.

The premise of this game is "number of dice rolls = points upon winning".

There are three conditions for winning
(1) The total number of die rolls won exceeds 10.
(2) Two consecutive dice with the same number of dice are taken.
(3) Taking 3 of your opponent's dice.

The first player to achieve this wins the game.

However, this game is unique in the way the dice are moved.
The position of the "â—" on the die's eye is the range of the die's movement.
For example, if the die is a 4, it is a die that moves one square to each of the four corners.
If the die has a "â—" in the center (1, 3, or 5), it will advance one square to the opponent's side.

When and how many squares are to be advanced, and which way the dice are to be turned?
This is an abstract game where you have to make careful decisions.

—description from the publisher

Name: Skytear: Untamed Expansion
Description:
Untamed is an expansion with 2 dual faction heroes that worship both Nupten and Liothan at once, helping you mix blue and yellow heroes together. In gameplay terms, when these heroes take a worship action you resolve both the blue and yellow worship in any order of your choice. This is the fourth and last release of the dual faction cycle including Stormsear, Winterdeep, and Unforgotten.

Untamed features the new type of power cards with two different kind of runes at once that can only be played by heroes with both runes. There are 5 blue/yellow and 5 red/yellow power cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Animo Dice
Description:
A reimagined twist on the famous classic game of Yahtzee - made simpler so even our younger ones can get in on the dice rolling fun!

Each player starts out with three cards (each card shows the faces of three random animals). They then take turns rolling all four dice in a bid to land a combination that matches any one of their three cards. The first player to manage this for all three cards wins!

Fosters:

     group play
     turn-taking and patience
     family/team bonding


Easily understood, played and enjoyed by the whole family!

—description from the publisher

Name: The Naval SITREP: The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #5
Description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system (Fear God and Dread Naught, Command at Sea and Harpoon) with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

The Naval SITREP Issue #5 was published in October 1995.

Table of contents:
Command at Sea scenario: Graff Spee's greatest battle
Korean counter correction
Northeast gaming group
Merchan ships size classes
HNR: Request for Submissions
China's small step foward
Wake isand defense update
Surface ship torpedo defense 
Scenario component checklist
Kitbash corner an upgraded Graff Spee
Platform Specifcations
Chinese Zhanjiang class
Chinese F-8 II Finback B
German Graff Spee
British Short Sunderland
Families: Magazine: The Naval SITREP – Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming

Name: Bogyó és Babóca: Furfangos párosító
Description:
we can meet with Berry, Dolly and their friends in smart card game. In the "matchmaker" the players have to look carefully what the dwellers of the forest are doing.
This fun card game helps to identify different concepts, improving association skills.
The players draw a card and put it next to each other. When a new card has a similar object on the picture as a previous one, the player says stop, defines the object category (like instrument, fruit, etc) and takes those two cards. Winner will be who has the most cards when the deck is empty.
The package also contains the rules of the popular Old Maid.

Name: Black Friday
Description:
Take part in the crazy sale! Grab your bargains before other shoppers snatch them from under your nose! Pass the aisles and buy the items you need before anyone else! Remember that you can only take items to the checkout if they fit in your basket. Your task is to complete the 7 shopping lists as quickly as possible. When one of you manages to do so, count up the points on the list cards. The player with the most points wins!

—description from the publisher

WeÅºcie udziaÅ‚ w szalonej wyprzedaÅ¼y! Korzystajcie z okazji, zanim inni klienci sprzÄ…tnÄ… je Wam sprzed nosa! Mijajcie sklepowe alejki i kupujcie potrzebne sprzÄ™ty przed innymi! PamiÄ™tajcie, Å¼e do kasy moÅ¼ecie zabraÄ‡ wyÅ‚Ä…cznie te towary, które zmieszczÄ… siÄ™ Wam do koszyka. Waszym zadaniem bÄ™dzie jak najszybsze zrealizowanie 7 list zakupów. Kiedy komuÅ› z Was uda siÄ™ tego dokonaÄ‡, podliczcie punkty na kartach z listami. Gracz, który uzyska najwiÄ™cej punktów, wygrywa!

—description from the publisher (Polish)

Nehmen Sie an dem verrückten Verkauf teil! Schnappen Sie sich Ihre Schnäppchen, bevor sie Ihnen von anderen vor der Nase weggeschnappt werden! Gehen Sie durch die Gänge und kaufen Sie die Artikel, die Sie brauchen, vor allen anderen! Denken Sie daran, dass Sie nur Artikel zur Kasse nehmen können, die in Ihren Warenkorb passen. Ihre Aufgabe ist es, die 7 Einkaufslisten so schnell wie möglich abzuarbeiten. Wenn einer von euch das geschafft hat, zählt ihr die Punkte auf den Listenkarten zusammen. Der Spieler mit den meisten Punkten gewinnt!

—description from the publisher (German)

Name: Moonrakers: Titan edition (Kickstarter Edition)
Description:
The Titan big box includes the content from Moonrakers expansions Binding Ties, Overload and Nomad as well as the Holographic Upgrade Pack. But it does not contain the base game.
This edition of the Titan Box was only be sold through a Kickstarter campaign.
All components are pre-packaged in the Titan Box. Expansion boxes are not included.

Content included:

    KS Exclusive Gold Foil Titan Box
    Binding Ties Expansion
    Overload Expansion
    Nomad Expansion
    Game Trayz Custom Insert
    Holographic Upgrade Pack


—description from designer

Name: Mafia: Miasto intryg
Description:
1920s, USA. The inhabitants of the small town of Sales do not know that there is a mafia in their midst doing its dirty business. Will the citizens manage to expose its members in time and foil their plans? The winner is the person remaining in the game, or all the members of the winning faction. Mafia - City of Intrigue is a social game for a group of 7 to 19 players, full of secret identities, bluff and manipulation.

—description from the publisher

Lata 20. XX wieku, USA. MieszkaÅ„cy maÅ‚ego miasteczka Sales nie wiedzÄ…, Å¼e wÅ›ród nich dziaÅ‚a mafia, która czyni swoje brudne interesy. Czy obywatelom uda siÄ™ w porÄ™ zdemaskowaÄ‡ jej czÅ‚onków i pokrzyÅ¼owaÄ‡ ich plany? WygrywajÄ… osoby pozostaÅ‚e w grze, lub wszyscy czÅ‚onkowie zwyciÄ™skiej frakcji. Mafia - Miasto Intryg to gra towarzyska dla grupy od 7 do 19 graczy, peÅ‚na sekretnych toÅ¼samoÅ›ci, blefu i manipulacji.

—description from the publisher (Polish)

Name: LA-1
Description:
Most detective work done in the city of LA-1 takes place under the perpetual dark clouds that still linger from the bombs. Even so, you plan to work together to gather clues, interrogate suspects, and go on stakeouts in a world that is divided by class and dominated by status. Use your skills to solve the case before the all-consuming darkness closes in forever.

In the story-driven, co-operative adventure game LA-1, you take on the role of detectives working for Mace & Doyle Investigations who are helping one another to resolve cases in the post-apocalyptic city that was once Los Angeles. Each case can be played individually or as part of a campaign. Because of the multiple cards that can send investigations in different directions, it's possible to play each case more than one time, having different situations and outcomes each time.  But cases must be solved before the Darkness closes in on all the investigators.

—description from the publisher

Name: Peninsula
Description:
Peninsula is a challenging and very strategic flip & write in which you are drawing the map of a fictional island. 
You draft symbols and draw them on adjacent hexes of your architect token, while offering symbols to your competitors to draw. 
Try to build an infrastructure, so your architect can move more efficiently over your map and stay flexible. Draw symbols, which increase your victory points and fulfill contracts along the way with your drawn patterns to please the monarch of your Peninsula.
The winner is determined, by points for the most efficient peninsula after the last symbol card is drafted.

The novel mechanism is that you cannot draw anywhere but only on adjacent hexes to your architect token. This forces players to move at the right time to the right place, otherwise players run out of hexes where they can draw new symbols.

Check the link below to get notified of our coming crowdfunding campaign.

Name: Growbot Smash
Description:
Combine cubes into robots!

Smash smaller robots in front of you, block the smaller robots behind you!

First person to make it around the board wins.

Burn cubes to move faster!

A roll-and-move game with some meaningful decisions. Given away for free on 1st August ('Bezday') 2022 to anyone subscribing to Bez's mailing list.

Includes rules for a legacy-style campaign where the board evolves after each game.

—description from the designer

Name: Roll and Safari
Description:
You are on a safari trying to photograph and research animals. Travel around the map to get in the best position in order to take the best picture.

The game is played over 13 rounds, with players playing simultaneously, trying to earn the most points by moving around the hexagon map and photographing animals.

Each Round you will roll 3 dice and then use those dice to move your safari car a certain direction, travel a specific distance, and then photograph in a certain direction. Try to move to the best spot and angle your camera the best direction to get the most points.

Visit Watering Holes to score extra points, photograph the round's featured animal to gain extra bonuses, and collect camera lenses to upgrade your camera and increase your photograph distance.

With just three dice and one printed paged, you will have a blast on your safari adventure rolling and photographing beautiful animals.

-description from designer

Name: Earth 2053: Tipping Point
Description:
In Earth 2053: Tipping Point, players represent countries that work together to prevent a global climate catastrophe. The main scoring happens on a physical seesaw board where "prevention" tokens are placed on one side and "pollution" tokens on the other. Filling the prevention side lets all players win (with optional placements based on who contributed the most). However, if the board tips towards the pollution side, all players lose.

Each player has their own country board with their own special ability, where they track their economy and their population's need fulfillment. Increasing the fulfillment levels of certain needs will unlock more and more powerful rewards, but at the same time threatens to create additional pollution.

One of the major goals of the game is to use your country's board setup to create "influence" tokens which can then be used to prevent climate events from (such as species extinction) from occuring in a negotiation about who is willing to invest how much per event. Stopping these events creates prevention points, while failing creates pollution.

The primary way of increasing need fulfillment is playing cards onto a grid shared between all players. Some cards have special effects depending on which other cards they are played adjacent to. Playing cards of the same category next to each other comes with its own set of bonuses.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pluzzables: Movies
Description:
Pluzzables are “playable puzzles” - a collection of puzzles you play as games after assembly. Additionally, several web apps come with the game for simpler "match and claim" or discovery games.

The Movies edition is a puzzle of a large collection of vintage movie posters. After assembly, the puzzle becomes a board game where players use web apps to play "Movie Madness", "Movie Match" and "Claim to Fame".

With the "Movie Match" web app, players compete to find specific posters in the puzzle shown by the app. However, something is missing and players must correctly tap the matching button to score. Score one point for every correct match. Lose three points for a miss.

With the "Mad About Movies" web app, players claim movie posters matching certain attributes.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport – Chaos in Copperforge
Description:
Copperforge is a gnomish city, and the center of arcano-mechanical invention in the world of the Red Dragon Inn. It’s Wizgille the Tinkerer’s hometown, and normally it’s the picture of peace and prosperity. Unfortunately, there are new and nefarious bad guys bringing all the cogwheel-ed chaos you can imagine to town!

In this expansion to our cooperative deckbuilding adventure game Battle for Greyport, you’ll be able to protect the landmarks of a whole new city, halt a train heist, and KO steampunk-flavored mecha pilots. New Scenarios, new Bosses, new Locations and new Monsters are all a part of the package!

EIGHT new playable heroes come to the game in this expansion. In addition, a new Contraption mechanic shakes up the game. Contraptions begin play ‘attached’ to Monsters, enhancing them with new or stronger abilities. When a Monster with a Contraption is Defeated, that Contraption becomes a resource for the heroes instead, to be played like an Item card.

-description from designer

Name: Wolf
Description:
WOLF is a solo Roll and Write game about the last months of the Battle of Atlantic in WWII, in which you are in command of a type VII U-Boat fighting for survive to an attack from an allied convoy decided to sink your submarine.

The game is played on 2 pages. You need 12 6-sided dice and a few of 8 m.m. cubes or pencil and eraser.

You reach victory when you have destroyed all the 6 enemies or escape definitely from their fire.

You lose the game when you have lost all the Hull points of your U-Boat.

North Atlantic. May 1943. You are in command of a type VII C U-Boat. You have just attacked a convoy of merchant ships with your wolfpack, but the revenge of the allies has been so brutal that 41 of 50 submarines have been sunk in the battle. As a result, you have been left isolated but intact, taking on the challenge of reaching safe harbor in the Bay of Biscay before being destroyed by an enemy fleet hunting your boat. You still have 10 torpedoes, the anti-aircraft guns and the morale of your crew to face the threats and survive the siege in which you have been involved.

Wolf is a solitaire game in Roll and Write mode that recreates the scenario of the Battle of the Atlantic, during World War II, when the "wolf pack" was losing its effectiveness due to technological and strategic advances by the allies.
Your mission is to cross the hexagons map from top left to top right before losing all your Hull points or losing power Battery points. Another way to achieve victory is by destroying the 6 enemies that siege your boat.

COMPONENTS
You will need 6 six-sided dice for the Action Dice; 2 6-sided dice for Threat Dice and 4 6-sided dice for Torpedo throwing.
Because it is a Roll and Write game, it can be played using a pencil and eraser or red and black marker and laminated game sheets. 8 millimeters of 2 different color cubes can also be used. Game sheets 1 and 2, plus this set of rules, are also required.

GAME SHEETS
Game sheet 1 displays the health status of your U-boat, i.e. Hull, Electric and Diesel tracks, as well as the Torpedo Room, Torpedo Tubes and the Battery . There are also spots to place Action and Threat dice.
On game sheet 2 you will find the Threat Chart, the Hexagons Map and the Tiefenmesser, Depth Indicator.

—description from designer

Name: The Lord of the Rings: Journeys in Middle-Earth – Scourges of the Wastes Figure Pack
Description:
The noble kingdom of Rohan has a long history of war, and the aftermaths of those wars can still be felt today in the unquiet dead of the marshes to the East and in the grudge held by the Dunlendings to the West. Now, an avaricious enemy has set plans in motion from the shadows, and you and your fellow heroes must uncover the conspiracy before Rohan is plunged into war once more…

The Scourges of the Wastes Figure Pack for The Lord of the Rings: Journeys in Middle-earth can enhance both the Spreading War campaign and the Poison Promise downloadable campaign. This pack contains three beautifully-sculpted new miniatures of the primary villains of the two campaigns, as well as five new item cards and a new role that can be used in any Journeys in Middle-earth adventure. No collection would be complete without it!

description from publisher's website

Name: The Lord of the Rings: Journeys in Middle-Earth – Poison Promise
Description:
Poison Promise is the third downloadable campaign available for purchase through the Journeys in Middle-earth companion app, offering a completely new set of quests and challenges. This campaign uses elements from both the Core Set and the Spreading War expansion, which means you will need both products in order to play. With a branching storyline full of twists and traitors and different endings depending on your choices and actions, you won’t want to miss out on the game’s longest campaign yet!

-description from publisher's website

Name: Citymagine
Description:
Citymagine is a cooperative boardgame in which each team manages one of the six neighbourhoods that together constitute a city.

Starting with urban problems (mobility, supply, pollution, promiscuity - sometimes accompanied by a lack of social ties), the participants reflect on their consumption patterns.

What is their project for society? What kind of world should we build for tomorrow? How can we invent other ways of living? Through these questions, "Citymagine" proposes to tell a new story for their city.

By involving their citizens, each neighbourhood will have to cooperate with other neighbourhoods to establish connexions between them to avoid hazards and to realize (common) deeds to decrease the ecological danger level of the planet to make it habitable again.

—description from the publisher

Each team starts with a number of inhabitants (meeples) and a number of hexes representing activities, which can be from the neighbourhood (use the team's inhabitants only) or common (inhabitants from other neighbourhood can participate if you manage to convince them).

Each round, teams can develop activities (placing an hexagon in the neighbourhood for each activity), each of them requiring a number of inhabitants; some inhabitants will only be needed to launch the activity (and can be reused next turn) while others will be occupied with the activity until the end of the game. At the end of each round, new inhabitants from the neighbourhood are recruited (1d6), allowing the teams to develop their neighbourhood further. After 5 rounds, players win if they manage to lower the ecological danger (whose level is represented on the wheel) to zero. There is an optional module (a kiosk) which requires an extra condition to win the game: 18 connexions between neighbourhoods must be made.

—user summary

Name: Millimemory
Description: In Millimemory / ãƒŸãƒªãƒ¡ãƒ¢ãƒªãƒ¼, players try to remember the length of everyday household items. Each player has an unmarked ruler to estimate the length and begins the game at 100 points. Players lose 1 point for each millimeter they are off the correct length. Players are eliminated when they run out of points, and the last player in the game wins.

Name: Pluzzables: Road Trip
Description:
Pluzzables are “playable puzzles” - a collection of puzzles you play as games after assembly. Additionally, several web apps come with the game for simpler "match and claim",  discovery or educational (math) games.

The Road Trip edition is a puzzle of 330 vintage North American license plates. After assembly, the puzzle becomes a board game where players use web apps to play several games like:

Road Trip: Find differences hidden between the puzzle and images shown in the app.

Plate Collector: Claim territory by matching contiguous plates to attributes revealed by the app.

License Plate Math: Find plates that match simple math equations generated by the app.

—description from the publisher

Name: MonstaTama
Description:
In MonstaTama, players compete to be the most renowned “monsta tama” by taming teams of monstas. To do this, players will carefully choose which monstas they plan to encounter on their journey, then decide what monstas to prioritize taming while on their journey.

MonstaTama is a competitive deck construction (not deck building) and queue management game. Despite sharing a game mechanic that is near exclusive to collectible card games, MonstaTama has been developed from the ground up to be played as a standalone experience with deck construction being a core part of gameplay. MonstaTama allows up to 4 players to express their ingenuity through deck construction, without any preparation before play and with just one copy of the game.

—description from the designer

Name: One and Done
Description:
One and Done is a casual card game with a dash of mischief and unpredictability. Players take turns giving one-word clues to get their team to complete as many fill-in-the-blank phrases as possible in 60 seconds. Clues should be chosen wisely, because players can only say one word and their team will only get one guess. But beware! At any point the opposing team can play 1 of 16 unique Set Back cards. These are challenges and disadvantages the other team must endure. They might be things like: erase the points you earned in the last round, steal your best player for the rest of the game, or make you dance non-stop while giving clues. The first team to survive the sabotage and correctly guess 21 fill-in-the-blank phrases wins.

One clue. One guess. Don't go _______!

—description from the publisher

Name: Eco Circle
Description:
In each turn, all players follow the turn flow simultaneously:

     Flip a card and form a combination of a living creature and a terrain.
     Draw the indicated creature on your own paper by the two following rules:
         Next to other living creature(s).  
         Next to the indicated terrain.
    
     Check if the drawing creature next to the same king of creature, you may get minus point due to competition.
     Check if any neighbouring creatures are eaten due to food chain rules, Cross the dead creatures.


Repeat the turn flow until all hexes are drawn, all scores are counted only when the game ends:

     Score points for each kind of living creatures that you have most.
     Score points for each full set of living creatures.
     Score points for each dead creature next to bacteria.

Name: AMBUSH
Description:
AMBUSH is an abstract board game designed largely on the use of the primitive shape - Triangle

The core object of AMBUSH is to colonise as many of your opponent's game tiles as possible.

You have to surround an opponent's triangular tile with 3 pieces of your own to colonise.

Build a prism token of yours on the opponent tile to signify your colony.

—description from the designer

Name: Kukacvadászat
Description:
Voracious worms ate the apples in the garden. Now it's useless trying to hide, the birds will find them sooner or later. Which little bird will be the most skillful? Which one will find the most worm?
Observe and memorize. Try to find which tree hides worms.
Roll the dice and move to a tree with your bird. Check if the tree hides a worm. Who finds the most worms wins the game.

Name: Disney Princess: Home Sprint
Description:
Play the Disney Princess Home Sprint Game, choose one of your favorite princesses: Ariel, Cinderella, Jasmine and Belle, then be the first home to win! While on the way home be careful as some spaces leap you forward, but others can make you miss a turn. This family-friendly game is fun for all ages from 4 years old upwards for 2-4 players, roll the dice and start your race home.

—description from the publisher

Name: Carnival Connect
Description:
Carnival Connect is a light-medium weight game, where neighbouring players must work together to build a shared Carnival, despite having different agendas!

Neighbouring players must plan and co-operate together if they are to put together just the right combination of colours, rides and train tracks to bag multiple bonus objective points. However, every player has their own scoring agenda in the form of the types of rides to build. Not only does the Carnival have limited space, but each round an old ride must be demolished to make way for new development.

How far will players be willing to demolish their scoring rides for a common goal? What negotiation skills and mind games will they bring into play? And how long will they work together amicably before the thought of demolishing their neighbour's high scoring rides becomes a juicy option?

At the end of the game, players are awarded points for the bonus objectives their Carnivals have bagged, combined with the number of rides from their scoring agenda that they have built into those Carnivals. The player with the highest total score wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: The Garden of the Moon: The Onward Path
Description:
"As the sun sinks, the birds of the sky turn into shadows.
You can’t sleep. You put on your coat and take a stroll through the streets drowned in the red tide of dusk.
Soon, you reach the outskirts of the city. You walk out through the Gate of Dreams."
Submitted for the Zine Quest challenge on Kickstarter.
An experimental RPG zine, with an eclectic combination of zen and baroque elements. It narrates the fantastical journey to "that secret crossroad of the worlds, the Garden of the Moon", the story being "sprinkled" with five challenges, in the form of five mini games.
The mini games are simple and accessible, their aim being to strike that thin balance between breeziness and enough challenge to make them interesting. The idea is to play the entire booklet at once, which will provide for unexpected intrigue and variety in this serene setting.

Name: The Naval SITREP: The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #6
Description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system (Fear God and Dread Naught, Command at Sea and Harpoon) with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

The Naval SITREP Issue #6 was published in January 1996.

Table of contents:
Harpoon scenario: Sea of Fire part 1
Miura SLT specs
