The Laws of the Navy
F-8 II Finback folloup
Mounting aircraft miniaturees
Sighting torpedo launches
CVBG components
Helmet-mounted sights
Naming ships
Corrections:
Graff Spee Form 10
Platform Specifications:
Japanese Kongo Class
Japanese F4EJ Kai
Families: Magazine: The Naval SITREP – Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming

Name: Splattered Smocks
Description: Klecks paints beautiful colorful pictures, but the little painter needs a lot of paint! The children move Klecks from paint tube to paint tube by turning over the picture cards and naming the colors. They collect blots of color on their smocks in the process. But be careful – Toffy the puppy likes stealing brushes! The first player to collect seven blots on their painting coat wins.

Name: Three Dice Horse Racing
Description:
Sports replay game of flat racing using real horse statistics and three dice.

Races take place over 4 to 7 rounds depending on the length of the race and, for each horse, the three dice generate a movement factor to which modifiers are applied to take account of the horse's qualities and whether it favours the early, middle or closing stages.

The system allows for starting odds to be generated for historic races based on actual results or, if pre-playing a race before the event, using official horse ratings.

Name: Escape from the Aquarium
Description:
The trip to the aquarium was everything you had imagined it would be … until suddenly, it all goes wrong! With just one drop of the magical waters, you’re accidentally transformed into a fish! The only way to break the spell and escape is with a mysterious potion, and the secret ingredients can only be uncovered by solving the puzzles hidden around the aquarium.

Including 11 different logic, number and observational puzzles. Players need to work together to find the answers as they embark on their quest to escape from the aquarium.

Name: Western Legends: Big Box Promo Pack
Description: Available during the Western Legends: Big Box Kickstarter campaign, either separately or with the Big Box.

Name: Lehigh Valley In A Box
Description:
Romantic covered bridges, rich Moravian heritage, and a door to the beginning of the industrial revolution, welcome to the Lehigh Valley! A treasure of nostalgia, culture and modern industry, she is also a region of natural splendor. Music is celebrated, wine is relished, and colors are born here. In this valley lies a one-of-a-kind sense of challenge on the Appalachian Trail, in the Velodrome, and in the river itself. The Lehigh Valley holds within it the glory of all that was, all that is, and all that will be.  Advertising space was not for sale on this game. The board includes authentic landmarks only.

Uses the same mechanics and rules as standard Monopoly.

Name: DEVOUR
Description:
DEVOUR is a light-weight, competitive, family card game featuring wildlife of the Northeastern United States bioregion.

DEVOUR is 3-games-in-1: PREY, FOREST FLOOR, and OUTFOXED.

In DEVOUR: PREY, you will take on the role of one of seven forest-dwelling creatures and feed upon as many of your opponents’ cards as possible. Bout after bout, play until the deck runs out to compete for your very survival. Marvel at over 55 unique animal illustrations. Discover creative visual card combos. Each turn play one (or more) of the predators from your hand. Be careful though, your opponent may strike a bit of luck when they roll the evasion die to dodge your attack. Try and establish the largest Feed Pile to become the one and only apex predator. Match-up the cards in your hand with their Main Food Source to further grow your Feed Pile. Prepare for weather events and hope that they will help you gain the upper hand. And don’t forget to activate your Animal Avatar’s special ability.
DEVOUR: PREY is a competitive, dueling card game for 2-3 players. Will you collect the most prey and elevate to the top of the food chain?

DEVOUR: FOREST FLOOR is a solo adventure. As Red Fox, you will explore the Forest Floor by flipping over animal cards and activating their unique abilities. Complete successful hunts to bring dinner back to Vixen and the Kits. But, beware! The denizens of the Forest Floor will do everything in their power to make your life difficult. Will you get stung by Yellow Jacket? Will you catch dinner, only to have it escape your clutches? Will Black Bear stop you in your tracks? Just make sure you capture your meal before Mountain Lion has YOU for dinner. Mountain Lion will be monitoring your activities on the edges of the Forest Floor acting as a timer and an additional source of danger. If he catches you in his line-of-sight, you will not be returning back to your den.
Uncover animals with unique abilities (over 35 in all), use guile to navigate the Forest Floor, remember where your friends are hiding, and complete over 25 unique storyline scenarios in campaign mode; with new scenarios added monthly.

In DEVOUR: OUTFOXED, you play as Red Fox or Crow in the wake of Aesop’s classic fable Fox and Crow. Crow is angry and blames Red Fox. Play as Crow and hatch schemes to thwart Red Fox’s hunting plans. Play as Red Fox and slyly avoid Crow’s conniving capers. As Crow, fly around the Forest Floor. Use your influence with your critter companions to rearrange the Forest Floor. Make life as difficult as possible for Red Fox; all while avoiding Red Fox’s ally, Bald Eagle! As Red Fox, avoid Crow’s ally, Black Bear, and prevent Crow from foiling your plans of returning to your den victorious after a successful hunt. Utilize all card abilities and enlist the aid of Vixen to protect your most valuable asset.
Use innovative strategies, tokens, standees, and special card abilities to outwit and outlast your opponent. This abstract strategy game for 2-players is only as challenging as your opponent.

In DEVOUR, you’ll learn about predator-prey relationships and the curious behaviors of wildlife in the northeast United States bioregion.

-description from designer

Name: The Gig: Encore! Expansion
Description:
The Gig: Encore! Expansion introduces 3 new instruments to the game, each with their own unique mechanics and a set of matching dice!

Use a quick hand to balance your drums with The Congas! Balance gentle harmonies with The Flute! And show off your natural scatting skills with The Scat Singer!

The Encore! Expansion is compatible with all game modes in The Gig, including solitaire mode!

Name: Klettermaxe
Description:
The wall of the house is divided into 64 spaces, of which 32 are represented by windows. There is climbing on the 32 sections of wall. The following are involved in the game: 4 police officers and Klettermaxe (cat burglar).
At the beginning of the game, the 4 policemen are hanging on the four lowest wall sections. Klettermaxe can start wherever he wants.
Klettermaxe and each policeman climb alternately by 1 space. Klettermaxe can go back and forth. The cops can only go forward.
If Klettermaxe manages to slip through the police chain, he wins. If he is trapped in such a way that he can no longer make a climbing move, the policeman who made the last move is the winner and may play Klettermaxe in the next game.
The game can be played by 2, 3 or 5 players, with 2 players one takes all 4 policemen, with 3 players 2 take 2 policemen each.

The game was published about 1950.

—user summary

Name: Jumanji
Description:
Danger lurks at every turn and on every turn, as you embark upon this epic adventure. Decode the secret rhyming messages, then race against time to roll the dice that can save you and your fellow player from the vicious crocs snapping jaws, the stealthy lions ferocious bite, or the charge of the trumpeting elephants. Double cross your opponent by strategically placing the rampaging rhino to block the path as you scurry toward the center of the board.

Using the same mechanics and board as the standard version, just slimmed down to a two player travel version.

Name: Make Your Words Count!
Description:
Make Your Words Count! Game

Using a pool of shared Vowel cards, players use the Consonant cards in their hand to try to make the largest word possible. Points are awarded for word length and bonus points can be earned. Be the first player to 100 points/high score by using the cards in your hand (5 or 7 cards dealt) to make words.

Name: Spy Sight
Description:
There are spies in our midst. Your mission: to use strategy, suspicion and logic to expose your opponent's spy before your spy is captured!!!

Uncover pieces by jumping over them. Use your Suspicion cards wisely to hazard a guess when you think you've spotted your opponent's Spy location.

Confuse your opponent by moving your pieces around and most of all protect your Spy from being exposed!

Use courage, intelligence, suspicion and logic to find and expose your opponent's Spy and WIN!

Name: Sinking Stones
Description:
Save yourself from drowning in the deep waters in this fast-paced strategy game. Hop off stones before they sink or grab a float to keep yourself safe! Can you survive the sinking stones?

—description from the publisher

Kids game based on turn taking, card play, and strategy to be last Peg left standing. Each turn a tile flips from stone to earth and players must plan where to move to safety and which cards to play to enhance their odds or trap an opponent.

—user summary

Name: Game Against Wolf
Description: A "Teen Wolf" themed adaptation of Cards Against Humanity using the same game mechanics.

Name: 花鳥風月 (Kacho Fugetsu)
Description:
In èŠ±é³¥é¢¨æœˆ (Kacho Fugetsu), players roll a die, moving that many spaces and performing the action shown on that space.  Players may then spend money to build a monument which may have various one time effects, round effects, or effects when the space is landed on.

Some turns will not be useful and there is no way to adjust the roll of the die.

A player whose money marker and honor point marker meet wins the game.
